intro: Stenanona panamensis, commonly known as the Panama stenanona, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
